name: Denny Kenaston
description:
Denny Kenaston (1949 - 2012)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Denny Kenaston in mp3 format. Denny were saved in 1972 out of the “Hippy culture.” The Lord Jesus delivered them from drugs, drinking, and many other things that go along with that life style. They felt the Lord call them to help establish Charity Christian Fellowship in Lancaster county.
Bro Denny served as an elder in his church for many years. He also traveled extensively in a church planting, and preaching ministry. God has placed an anointing upon him to call the church back to a burden for the family. Tens of thousands of tape set have been sent out all over the world in the last twelve years. Many families have fallen on their faces in repentance, and received a new vision for a Godly Home.

sermons.title: (Christ) Christ Our Example
(Christ) The "In Christ" Life
(Christ) The Incomparable Christ
sermons.description: Brother Denny eloquently preaches on Christ and Who He is (2 Cor. 4:3-6 and John 1:1, 14). All through history His footprints can be traced. If we do not change, we have not seen Him. Oh to behold Him and gaze upon Him, it will bring change into our lives.

sermons.title: (Christ) The Power of Christ-Centered Theology - Part 1
(Christ) The Power of Christ-Centered Theology - Part 2
(Christ—The Way God Makes Man Righteous) 1. God's So Great Salvation
(Christ—The Way God Makes Man Righteous) 10. Regeneration—Born of the Spirit
(Christ—The Way God Makes Man Righteous) 11. The Just Shall Live Continually by Faith
(Christ—The Way God Makes Man Righteous) 12. Sanctification, Surrender, and Sanctification
(Christ—The Way God Makes Man Righteous) 13. Righteousness Imparted
(Christ—The Way God Makes Man Righteous) 14. Salvation Is Jesus Christ
(Christ—The Way God Makes Man Righteous) 15. The Consummation of Salvation

(Christ—The Way God Makes Man Righteous) 3. The Fallen State of Man
(Christ—The Way God Makes Man Righteous) 4. The Theology of Atonement
(Christ—The Way God Makes Man Righteous) 5. Christ, the Atonement
(Christ—The Way God Makes Man Righteous) 6. How God Helps Man See His Need
(Christ—The Way God Makes Man Righteous) 7. Conviction Leads to Repentance
(Christ—The Way God Makes Man Righteous) 8. Saving Faith
(Christ—The Way God Makes Man Righteous) 9. The Righteousness of Faith
(Divine Attributes) 01 Visions of the Glory of God
sermons.description: Examples of men who saw the bright outshining of God's holy nature and character. Only one word can describe what they saw: awesome. We need to re-gain a high and lofty concept of God again in our churches. Our shallow vision of God must be replaced with a glorious view of the Almighty.

sermons.title: (Divine Attributes) 02 A High and Lofty View of God
sermons.description: Our problem in this land is that we have humanized God. In Genesis Satan cast a bad reflection on the character of God. As men we have lost a high view of God. This has affected every area of our life and society.

sermons.title: (Divine Attributes) 03 God the Omnipotent Creator
sermons.description: God's creative ability is shown not only in the world He made, but also in the new life He puts in our hearts. In light of the rest of God's attributes, can He be other than all-powerful?

sermons.title: (Divine Attributes) 04 Jehovah, the Eternal Self-Existent One
sermons.description: God lives in the ever-present now. He is the cause, means, and end of all things in the entire universe and is independent of any other being or cause.

sermons.title: (Divine Attributes) 05 God Mysterious
sermons.description: God is both knowable and unknowable. He is hidden from human understanding on purpose to excite interest and wonder. He is not the highest at the top of all beings; He is altogether other. It is hard to come in awe before a God that we have completely figured out.

sermons.title: (Divine Attributes) 06 The Immensity of God
sermons.description: All of God's attributes are without limit, and yet none is greater than another; e.g., God doesn't have more mercy than justice. To Him space means nothing at all. He fills all things, and they continue to exist by His preservation.

sermons.title: (Divine Attributes) 07 God's Unchanging Perfections
sermons.description: None of God's attributes can change. It is not possible for Him to become any more holy than He already is. God has no necessary relationships outside of Himself. We are not indispensable to God, but we do have the privilege of serving Him.

sermons.title: (Divine Attributes) 08 Glory to the Omnicient Only Wise God
sermons.description: God knows all there is to know—instantly, effortlessly. He looks at all the tenses of time: past, present, and future, and sees them in the ever-present now. You can trust your life to His all-wise control.

sermons.title: (Divine Attributes) 09 The Sovereign Triune God of the Universe
sermons.description: God owns and rules with absolute freedom and authority to do whatever He wants, and gives no account to anyone. No one can stop Him. "Shall not the judge of all the earth do right?" Each Person in the Trinity clearly manifests all of God's attributes.

sermons.title: (Divine Attributes) 10 The Awesome Knowledge of the Holy
sermons.description: God's mercy and love can only be understood when we know God's holiness. There are two sides to God's holiness: an awesome, negative, fearful side, and a beautiful, positive side. Holiness is the complete absence of sin and evil, plus the total presence of all God's attributes and character.

sermons.title: (Divine Attributes) 11 The Righteous Judgment of Almighty God
sermons.description: God's justice is a balancing of the scales, the application of moral equity to a moral situation. It is not only negative, but also positive.

sermons.title: (Divine Attributes) 12 The Divine Perfections of God's Love (Part 1)
sermons.description: God is benevolent to what He created. We dwell under a friendly sky. Even the lost man receives life and breath from God. There is no greater display of God's perfections than His love in redeeming man.

sermons.title: (Divine Attributes) 13 The Divine Perfections of God's Love (Part 2)
sermons.description: God felt compassion for our need and stooped down in pity to meet it. His mercy did not begin at Calvary, but it led Him there. His grace is seen in that He turns to look on us with favor and shines His face upon us.

sermons.title: (Divine Attributes) 14 The Humility of God
sermons.description: God is humble in His essential being. This attribute is clearly seen in Jesus' incarnation, life, and death. We can only be humble when we are in the presence of the Holy Spirit.

sermons.title: (Divine Attributes) 15 Partakers of God's Divine Nature
sermons.description: This is the essence of real Christianity: counting all things loss for the knowledge of God. It is dangerous to emphasize any one of God's attributes more than another because it leads to a lopsided view of God. Practical ways to continue our study of the attributes of God are given.

sermons.title: (Dreams & Visions of a Godly Home) A Home FOR GOD
(Dreams & Visions of a Godly Home) Holy Dreams & Visions
(Dreams & Visions of a Godly Home) How Do I Prepare? (Part 1)
(Dreams & Visions of a Godly Home) How Do I Prepare? (Part 2)
(Dreams & Visions of a Godly Home) The Beautiful Influence Of A Godly Home
(Early Anabaptism) Christ in Early Anabaptism
sermons.description: The history of the church has many treasures for us today. God calls us to walk about Zion and to study it's bulwarks. The history of the early Anabaptist is one rich and alive with the personal testimonies of men and women who found the living God. The deaths that so many of them suffered for Christ brought life all over Europe. God and His principles have not changed. Life in our lives and communities will come in the same way.

sermons.title: (Early Anabaptism) Foundation Stones in the Anabaptist Faith
sermons.description: A personal relationship with Jesus, fellowship, accountability, evangelism, and the two kingdoms are a few of the foundations of the Anabaptist faith and practice. Jesus Christ was the chief cornerstone of all of their lives. They lived their lives by His example. Their evangelism, fellowship, and other doctrines flowed out of a life given totally to Christ. This is a very needed message for us as their descendants to practice today.

sermons.title: (Early Anabaptism) Gelassenheit—Complete Surrender
sermons.description: God calls His children to complete surrender to Him. The early Anabaptists lived this surrender from day one of their baptism. There wes no middle ground. It was either everything for the Lord or nothing at all. Baptism for them meant very possible death any day forward from then. What does complete surrender mean for you today? Should it be any less radical?

sermons.title: (Early Anabaptism) Reviving the Righteous Root of Anabaptism
sermons.description: Oh that God would restore His people to the pristine beauty they once had. The beauty that came, not from Anabaptism, but from the righteous root of Jesus Christ Himself! This message is a challenge to set our sights on everything Jesus bought and paid for, in the shedding of His blood. Will we return to the "all or nothing" mentality, making a clear commitment to evangelism, Christ, and persecution as did they? The combination of these is what kept their lives alive!!

sermons.title: (Early Anabaptism) The Anabaptist Vision
sermons.description: A Spirit-borne vision is a revealing of the will and mind of God. What we are and what we have is a result of our vision. What is your vision? What do you see? The Anabaptist movement today is a sleeping giant. Persecution is coming to this land, and there will be an awakening sooner or later. May God help us to see what He sees, to awake, and to prepare—to be radical followers of the Lamb.

sermons.title: (Early Anabaptism) The Approaching Wave of Persecution
sermons.description: Do you believe that American Christians will face persecution in the near future? Across many denominations the answer is the same. About 75% of the people will answer yes without hesitation. What are we doing to prepare our children for this persecution? Are we ready to face it? The Bible is clear that our enemy, Satan, will make war against us and try to wear out the saints. This message brings in scriptures that make this clear. This message also gives some clear direction for preparation that we can do, so that we are ready to stand.

sermons.title: (Early Anabaptism) Theology Versus Anabaptist Reality
sermons.description: In the days of the early Anabaptists there was a stark difference between them and the Reformed churches of the day. Anabaptists believed that they had been living wrong and repented to be followers of the Lord Jesus Christ. The Reformers merely changed the theology they taught in their churches. Are you a follower of the Lord Jesus Christ or have you only changed your "belief"?

sermons.title: (Godly Courtship) 01 Godly Courtship (Part 1)
sermons.description: Courtship is God's best and how few of us miss of all of God's best in our lifes and know nothing of it. We should not settle less then God's best found in Holy Scriptures, this is a generation that does not know of God's commands and holy ways.

sermons.title: (Godly Courtship) 02 Godly Courtship (Part 2)
(Godly Courtship) 03 Godly Courtship (Part 3)
(Godly Courtship) 04 Testimonies Of Courtship
(Godly Courtship) 05 Godly Courtship - Question & Answer
(Godly Courtship) 06 Marriage, Courtship And Marriage
(Godly Home) Part 1 - The Holy Art of Training Children
sermons.description: The Holy Art of Training Children commences on lifting the principles of childraising out of the commonplace and making them holy again.  Denny Kenaston challenges fathers to repent of unscriptural focuses and embrace the 'beautiful realities of the Word of God.'  Raising children is an art, 'a system of principles and methods employed in the creation of making something beautiful.'  Are you ready to be a student of training children?

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 10 - The Hearts of the Fathers Must Turn
sermons.description: Denny Kenaston analyzes in detail what the Word of God has to say about the absolute necessity of a father's heart turned towards his children.  The heaviest load falls upon the fathers to represent God to the children, and without that flow of the turned heart in love, time, discipline and teaching, the inevitable result is the curse of disobedience which plagues so much of American society today.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 11 - The Rod is Love
sermons.description: Denny Kenaston shares the biblical perspective of disciplining children by use of the rod.  "Spanking is not a negative form of discipline," he says, but is a beautiful expression of love, for whosoever the Lord loves He chastens.  Kenaston takes great care to explain why the Bible teaches the need for spanking to properly raise up godly children.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 12 - A Sacred Exercise
sermons.description: Denny Kenaston presents a very practical and balanced view of discipline, pointing out that parents ought to take serious heed not to spank in anger, for chastisement "is not judgment meted out for doing wrong; it is correction for wrong with the hope of future good."  Brother Denny labors through his practical example of disciplining his own children to pattern it as closely as possible to the way the heavenly Father disciplines us.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 13 - The Training of the Will
sermons.description: Training a child's will, says brother Denny, "is the foundation for a prosperous, spiritual life."  Teaching the children to cheerfully and willingly obey the parents will allow them to more quickly and easily yield to God whenever He comes to ask for surrender.  Several practical exercises are given to help parents begin training sessions at a very early age.  "Little lessons transfer into big obediences someday."

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 14 - The Bondage of Foolishness
sermons.description: Denny Kenaston provided a "gold mine of discernment" about what the Bible says foolishness really is, how to identify it and correct it in a child.  He offers sound, practical wisdom of dealing with the real problem that will prevent much poor character in the latter years.  "Terrible twos" should not be in the vocabulary of Christian parents, and following God's wisdom clears the child's conscience and provides rest and delight in the home.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 15 - Father - the Anointed Teacher
sermons.description: Brother Denny exhorts fathers in their God-appointed role to "live on the edge of the impossible" by trusting God to work through them.  He shares on six holy qualities a father must have to effectively teach his children.  Kenaston strongly advocates making family devotions a top priority and shares from personal experience how the Lord has wrought godliness in his home through adopting that.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 16 - Train Up a Child
sermons.description: Brother Denny illustrates how training and nurturing are "a beautiful blend of teaching, discipline, love and the actual guiding of a life in a right path."  Do you want your child to be a soul winner or prayer warrior?  What do you want to teach them?  He gives several practical ways of going about the training process in a purposeful, God-centered way.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 17 - A Quiet, Ordered Life
sermons.description: Brother Denny continues along the guiding, training aspects of raising children by showing how God is primarily a leader not a corrector.  He teaches how your home can become a "haven of rest and refreshment" by taking proactive leadership with your children in the good and right way.  Four ways of establishing calm, quiet authority are addressed along with four categories of parenting, good and bad.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 18 - Three Mysterious Influences in the Home
sermons.description: Brother Denny highlights three supernatural influences in our homes that are beyond power to explain or understand: 1) the powerful atmosphere of the Spirit of God, 2) the power of an enthusiastic example, and 3) prevailing intercessory prayer.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 19 - Children - a Dwelling Place for the Living God
sermons.description: Have you ever wondered how child training in spiritual disciplines (i.e., prayer, Bible reading, fasting, and so on) works when the child is not yet born again?  Brother Denny shares how parents who diligently apply themselves in training the body and soul of their children do them such a favor and give them a headstart when the Spirit of God does come to indwell them.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 2 - The Foundation of a Godly Home
sermons.description: Brother Denny shares how this could be the most important message of the whole series.  Many people want to have a godly home but are getting the 'cart before the horse' if Christ is not all in all.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 20 - Father is a Watchman
sermons.description: "The father is the Nehemiah of the house", brother Denny cautions, the one to raise up the wall of biblical standards to protect the family and the gatekeeper to watch for subtle influences that gradual erode the spiritual life of it.  Kenaston blows a bold trumpet of alarm against many harmful and destructive influences of our day, such as television, movies, toys, computer games, books, Internet, Christian "rock" music, and children's videos.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 21 - The Hidden Women
sermons.description: Brother Denny encourages wives how vital and essential their role is in having a godly home.  He shares how powerful an influence a hidden woman has on the life of her husband, motivating and energizing him to fulfill God's calling on his life.  He then speaks on the power of a submissive spirit and how getting outside of God's creative purpose is likened to a fish out of water.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 22 - Where are the Men
sermons.description: "The challenge of the hour is for leadership in the home," says Denny Kenaston.  Who will rise to the challenge?  Brother Denny sounds a clarion call to the men to rise up from their apathy and respond to the call of God to be godly husbands and fathers.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 23 - Fighting Battles for the Next Generation
sermons.description: "The children will possess what the parents fought for in the Christian life," assures Denny Kenaston.  A disciplined and abundant Christian life is something very much worth fighting for for God's glory and the for the sake of the children.  Have we stopped fighting for more land?

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 24 - Godly men have radiant Wives
sermons.description: Denny Kenaston shares how the woman is the glory of the man; therefore the husband needs to take care of his "glow-ry".  A number of practical ways husbands can lay their lives down for their wives are things like praise and attention, quality time, unconditional love and acceptance.  These expressions of love are what contribute to a radiant wife who is the crown of her husband.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 25 - Joining the Next Generation
sermons.description: Denny Kenaston gives five crucial reasons why parents must get involved with their children's choice of a marriage partner: false Christians, high divorce rate, powerful emotions, compatibility issues, and the rewards of a happy marriage.  Brother Denny also shares from the first marriage in the Garden of Eden why both physical and emotional virginity are so vital to safeguard, as well as some practical advice to some "touchy issues" such as sensuous clothes, flirting and "the dating game".

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 26 - Youth - Anointed Disciples of Jesus Christ
sermons.description: "Godly youth will bless and sanctify the atmosphere of your home," says Brother Denny.  He offers 8 ways in which parents can make disciples of the Lord Jesus Christ out of the youth in the home.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 27 - Households on Fire
sermons.description: Brother Denny makes the connection between revival, the home, and evangelism as he brings "The Godly Home" series to a close.  To parents who may feel overwhelmed by the high standards presented in the Word of God, he strongly encourages that with God all things are possible!

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 28 - The overtaking Blessings on the Second Generation
sermons.description: Daniel Kenaston (Denny Kenaston's eldest son, a missionary to West Africa) shares what it was like growing up under the biblical principles of the godly home.  Daniel encourages parents to seek God's best for their children and to be like Caleb who fought for the next generation.  Says young Kenaston, "Your children will fly where you walked because of the foundation you've given them."

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 3 - The Eternal Value of a Child
sermons.description: This is the first of six sessions on the visionary aspect of childrearing.  Kenaston preaches his heart out to impart the value a child has in eternity.  We can see what priority our children have by the time we give them.  Do we realize we are raising sons and daughters for the King of Kings and Lord of Lords?  If so, it will change our whole life's ambition in the way we bring them up.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 4 - A Vision that Motivates
sermons.description: Part 2 of the visionary aspect of childraising stresses how essential having a vision is, for without a vision, the people perish.  'A vision is a mental image imprinted upon the heart by the Spirit of God.'  Kenaston shows God's purpose to train up many generation families to win a lost and dying world, showing several examples from the Bible.  If God did it for them, He can do it for you!

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 5 - A Godly Heritage Today
sermons.description: Kenaston passionately speaks of several recent examples of many generation families who have done great exploits for the kingdom of God.  He sites William and Catherine Booth's eight children and 45 children on fire for God as one such role model, as well as Hudson Taylor's and Jonathan Edwards'.  He closes by sharing how greatly influenced he was by a Canadian family 22 years prior whose family life and influence in the community burned a new vision in his heart and altered his course forever.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 6 - Bible Pictures of Promise
sermons.description: Kenaston draws much food for thought out of three powerful visions from the Psalms as to what children for God are supposed to be like.  For instance, children are likened to the olive tree, which is one of the most valuable possessions and when well tended to produces its precious oil for many generations to come.  Kenaston encourages parents that "God [is] putting His hand upon my hand raising my children through me."

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 7 - More Pictures of Promise
sermons.description: Kenaston debunks the purposeless attitude, "I think my children will turn out alright," by demonstrating the biblical truth that strong foundations of a Christian life are needed to produce many generations of righteous offspring.  Childraising is to be as purposeful as the Israelite warrior who meticulously prepared his arrows to destroy the enemy.  "What is success," brother Denny asks, "a big pile of money or a bunch of arrows in your quiver ready to go?"

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 8 - Wholehearted Households
sermons.description: Brother Denny shares the last of six sessions of the visionary aspect of childrearing of how whole-hearted households affect the next generation.  He goes into detail of what an ordered Jewish home like one Jesus or John the Baptist was raised in to raise the bar of our own expectations.  "A man's family," Kenaston says, "is the greatest revelation of who he is.  Are we too busy to raise godly children that will "hit the mark" someday?

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 9 - The Key to Obedience is Blessings
sermons.description: This teaching has "the most profound wisdom" in all child training--love.  Brother Denny uncovers the fallacy that spanking solves all the woes in the family when a close, loving, flowing relationship between parent and child is missing.  Our modern society is all about the quick fix, but there is no substitute for time when it comes to developing a genuine foundation of love in the godly home.

sermons.title: (Guidelines for Winning Souls) Are You A Soulwinner?
(Guidelines for Winning Souls) Attitudes That Defeat Us In Soulwinning
(Guidelines for Winning Souls) Drawing The Net
(Guidelines for Winning Souls) How to Win a Soul
(Guidelines for Winning Souls) Lead a Soul to Christ
(Guidelines for Winning Souls) The Effective Use of Questions
(I Am a Disciple of Jesus Christ) A Disciple Is Other Worldly
sermons.description: This is an in-depth definition of true discipleship given in the form of a confession of faith. Brother Denny covers sixteen clear areas of discipleship. These are drawn from teachings of the Lord Jesus Christ and applied to our present-day youth. He challenges youth to shake off the stigma of Generation X and be radical disciples of Jesus.

sermons.title: (I Am a Disciple of Jesus Christ) Introduction
sermons.description: This is an in-depth definition of true discipleship given in the form of a confession of faith. Brother Denny covers sixteen clear areas of discipleship. These are drawn from teachings of the Lord Jesus Christ and applied to our present-day youth. He challenges youth to shake off the stigma of Generation X and be radical disciples of Jesus.

sermons.description: This is an in-depth definition of true discipleship given in the form of a confession of faith. Brother Denny covers sixteen clear areas of discipleship. These are drawn from teachings of the Lord Jesus Christ and applied to our present-day youth. He challenges youth to shake off the stigma of Generation X and be radical disciples of Jesus.

sermons.description: This is an in-depth definition of true discipleship given in the form of a confession of faith. Brother Denny covers sixteen clear areas of discipleship. These are drawn from teachings of the Lord Jesus Christ and applied to our present-day youth. He challenges youth to shake off the stigma of Generation X and be radical disciples of Jesus.

These are drawn from teachings of the Lord Jesus Christ and applied to our present-day youth. He challenges youth to shake off the stigma of Generation X and be radical disciples of Jesus.

(Timeless Doctrines) Revelation's Timeless Doctrines - Part 1
(Timeless Doctrines) Revelation's Timeless Doctrines - Part 2
(Timeless Doctrines) Revelation's Timeless Doctrines - Part 3
(Timeless Doctrines) Revelation's Timeless Doctrines - Part 4
(Timeless Doctrines) What Kind Of A Church Do You Go To? - Part 5
(Timeless Doctrines) What Kind Of A Church Do You Go To? - Part 6
(Youth Bible School 2007) By Faith Possess Patience, Godliness, and Love
sermons.description: This sermon has much practical application for the believer in Jesus Christ. If you are not experiencing the Christian life like you know should be available for you, this message is the answer for you.

sermons.title: (Youth Bible School 2007) By Faith Possess Virtue, Knowledge, and Temperance
sermons.description: Are you a real soldier of Jesus Christ? This is a very clear teaching on what a true soldier's character is like. This message is of absolute importance for every true Christian.

sermons.title: (Youth Bible School 2007) Let Us Go In and Possess the Land
sermons.description: Are there seeming impossibilities and giants in your life? Are there areas in your life you seem powerless to overcome? In this message, Brother Denny challenges us to press in by God's divine help. He clearly lays out principles of how to conquer these spiritual giants in our lives. Jesus truly has and is the way to help us overcome.

sermons.title: (Youth Bible School 2007) Make Your Calling and Election Sure
sermons.description: Do you see the great calling that God has for your life? In this message, Brother Denny reveals how you can have true agape love that works out in your hearts and actions towards others in a practical way. At the end of this life, you can hear God say, "Well done, thou good and faithful servant."

sermons.title: (Youth Bible School 2007) The Faith of the Apostles
sermons.description: Godliness is not an option, but is of absolute importance! In this message, Brother Denny clearly shows forth the faith of the apostles and how this true belief in Jesus Christ and His finished work on the cross will radically change your heart, life, and destiny.

sermons.title: (Youth and the Fires of Devotion) The Fire Of His Glory
(Youth and the Fires of Devotion) The Fire On The Altar That Consumes
(Youth and the Fires of Devotion) The Fire That Burns Incense
(Youth and the Fires of Devotion) The Fire That Illuminates
(Youth and the Fires of Devotion) The Fire That Makes Bread
A Declaration of the Faith
A Declaration of the Faith - Part 6
sermons.description: The true faith exposes the end-time apostasy, which is producing "Christian" lawlessnes. It opposes amusements and entertainments. The faith is safe, sound security that is conditional. The faith is opposed to any involvement in witchcraft, yet believes in the miraculous. The faith is expressed in modesty and simplicity. The faith is unity in the true body of Christ.

sermons.title: A Godly Heritage (alternative)
A Parable of Security, Stagnation, Seduction, Survival - Part 1
A Parable of Security, Stagnation, Seduction, Survival - Part 2
A Season Alone With God
Adorning the Gospel of God Our Saviour (Part 1)
An Inspirational History of the Mission
Baptism Of The Holy Ghost & New Testament Reality
Beautiful Attitudes
Behold the Lamb
Biblical Apparel
sermons.description: Some practical suggestions on Christian appearance. Looks at very specific examples on what is and what is not godly apparel.

sermons.title: Biblical Obedience
Biblical Principles On The Headship Veiling
sermons.description: A study from I Corinthians 11:1-16 on the head covering. This message looks at several principles that flow out of this passage concerning the head covering. See #1069 for an exegesis of the passage.

sermons.title: Christian Life According to John (Part 1)
Christian Life According to John (Part 2)
Christian Life According to John (Part 3)
Christian Life According to John (Part 4)
Christian Life According to John (Part 5)
Christian Maturity
Conquering Warriors
sermons.description: As Christians we must be on the offensive. The reality of spiritual war should not send us shrinking off into hiding, but motivate us to step out and reach out to others. Come fight in a war that sheds no blood, against an enemy you cannot see, and for a Commander who cannot lose.

sermons.title: Consecrating Our Children To God
Continuous Revival - The New Testament Standard
sermons.description: What does it mean to live in continuous revival? Many people think living in revival means an exceptional spiritual experience reserved for a few extraordinary people, but in reality, the experience that we call revival is what God wants every one of His children to have. Walking with God, having a clear conscience, and being filled with the power of the Spirit is supposed to be normal.

sermons.title: Crowns of Eternal Reward
sermons.description: There are many crowns promised as reward both now and in the life to come. Denny exhorts us to stay single eyed and focused lest we forfit our reward as an overcomer or bear the fruit of a faithful life. Final 30 minutes are testimonies and response. Recorded during a fellowship fasting weekend 2005.

sermons.title: Crying Out
Deliverance From Specific Bondages (Part 1)
sermons.description: This is the first tape of two messages discussing deliverance from specific sins. We can be freed from our chains. Brother Denny explains God's method of rescue before he goes on to discuss the bondages of bitterness and witchcraft.

sermons.title: Deliverance From Specific Bondages (Part 2)
sermons.description: A continuation of tape number three, this message deals with the bondages of rebellion, music, moral sins and eating disorders.

sermons.title: Discouragement (Letting The Fire Go Out)
Enduement Of Power - How It Is Obtained
sermons.description: A powerful message on the Baptism of the Holy Spirit experience in the Bible. Brother Denny Kenaston preaches with unction on this very important subject. He shares how God works in many ways to fill people with His Holy Spirit and we cannot put God in a box. The genuine experience of the Holy Spirit is still available to believers today.

sermons.title: Four Men With a Vision
Gift Of A Pastor
God's Holy People
God's Invitation
God's Pursuit Of Man
sermons.description: We are familiar with A.W. Tozer's book on "The Pursuit of God." In this message Brother Denny points to the ways God pursues us. A great message of the heart of God towards His own creation.

sermons.title: Godly Sorrow-the Way to Revival
Him Or It?
Honorable Motherhood
sermons.description: Raises motherhood to a high and honorable place. Discusses the power and influence of a mother. This message will cause young ladies to covet the place of motherhood. A good complementary message to The Hidden Woman.

sermons.title: How Do I Humble Myself? (Part 1)
How Do I Humble Myself? (Part 2)
How to Be Changed
How to Build a Church
How to Know the Will of God
sermons.description: God desires for you to know His will. Seven biblical steps are given to find God's will for your life. This message is very good for those who are facing a major decision.

sermons.title: How to Overcome Evil
Human Authorities-God's Servants
Humility Is Laying Down Our Lives For Others
I Am Crucified With Christ
It's Time to Seek the Lord
Jealous for the Testimony of the Lord
sermons.description: Brother Denny Kenaston has been diagnosed with stage 4 cancer of the brain. He came back on April 22, 2012 to a church he planted to share the burden of the Lord with them. He confessed many of his failures and sins over the years and humbled himself before the body of Christ.

sermons.title: Lead a Soul to Christ
Life Changing Choices
Lord, Send Revival
sermons.description: The powerful reality of revival is a visit from God. When revival comes, hardened sinners are softened, youth rush to the meetings, holy people go deeper with God, and family altars catch fire. Revival is not something of the past—it's for our day!! This message will spur you on to seek revival for yourself.

sermons.title: Marks of the End-Time Church
Ministering in the Mission Field
Motherhood, The Highest Place Of Honor
sermons.description: The virtuous woman of Proverbs 31 was a mother! An uplifting look at motherhood as found in Proverbs 31. An excellent message of inspiration for women who have committed themselves to be a keeper at home.

sermons.title: My Personal Testimony
sermons.description: Denny shares his personal testimony of salvation and fuller consecration to God concerning his family.

sermons.title: My Place in God's Eternal Purpose
Others
sermons.description: Denny Kennesaton speaks on the subject of loving one another as Christ loved us. He shows through personal testimony and clear scriptural teaching the wonderful principle on serving others above yourself. True love is sacrifical love that will seek others before self. This is the Christ-like attitude that we need to walk in: Others first.

sermons.title: Our Need of Personal Revival
sermons.description: God is longing to bring revival to our hearts and He wants to destroy the enemy of sin in our lives, but many times we are so busy "working" without being vitally connected to Him that we close our hearts to His power. If we do not realize how desperate and needy we are without the power of the Holy Spirit in our spiritual lives, we will never experience true, heaven-sent revival.

sermons.title: Overwhelmed With The Presence Of The Living God
Pastors Call to Action
Paul the Apostle - A Vibrant Life (Part 1)
Paul the Apostle - A Vibrant Life (Part 2)
Paul the Apostle - A Vibrant Life (Part 3)
Paul the Apostle - A Vibrant Life (Part 4)
Paul the Apostle - A Vibrant Life (Part 5)
Paul's Vision for More Leaders
Practical Applications to Music
sermons.description: Discusses the principles governing right music. The biblical pattern for music found in Ephesians 5 and Colossians 3 is outlined. These principles are illustrated by specific songs.

sermons.title: Prophetic Prayers of the Master Builder
Real Revival
sermons.description: "We stand in great danger of being satisfied."  Denny Kenaston's heart was burdened to have real revival and to motivate further prayer for it.  He warned against dead orthodoxy (correct doctrine without life) and even enjoying God's blessings so as to not pursue God's best.  The inspiration for the address came from Duncan Campbell's "When God Stepped Down", an accounting of the amazing Hebrides revival around 1952.

sermons.title: Rejoice With The Wife Of Thy Youth
Revivals in the Bible and in History
sermons.description: We find records in the Word of God of times when He visited His people in very powerful ways. God has recorded these for our instruction, inspiration, and also that we would cry out to Him to do it again. Bro Denny reviews the recorded revival of David's time, and and also of King Josiah's reign. He also recounts a few examples from more recent history.

sermons.title: Reviving the Righteous Root of Anabaptism
Tear Down the Strongholds
sermons.description: This message discusses satanic strongholds and the place they have in our lives. The bondages of fear and curses are also addressed.

sermons.title: Ten Commandments For Revival
The Anointed Body of Christ in China
The Approaching Wave of Persecution
sermons.description: Brother Denny Kenaston shares his burden on the coming persecution that will come in the end times but very possibly soon to Christianity world-wide. He clearly shows biblically that if we are of the kingdom of Christ the kingdom of this world will be in opposition against us. We need to prepare for this and prepare to love our enemies and share the Gospel.

sermons.title: The Beauty and Power of Unity
The Church - God's Anointed Servant
The Church Beautiful
The Church That Revival Built
sermons.description: There are many churches in our land today, and many of them draw large crowds of people. How can we discern whether they are part of the church that Jesus said He would build? Beginning with the birth of the Church at Pentecost, this inspiring message lays out ten distinct markings of the church of which Christ said, "...the gates of hell shall not prevail against it".

sermons.title: The Church at Ephesus
The Cry of God's Heart
The Danger Of Anti-Group Attitudes
sermons.description: Denny Kenaston speaks powerfully about an heart issue that many christians must deal with. We have a negative unforgiving in our hearts towards other church groups that we have been hurt by or left. We need to cater a christ-like attitude towards others.

sermons.title: The Dangers of The Christian Radio
The Day That Belongs to the Lord
The Generation Gap - Part 1
The Generation Gap - Part 2
The Gift of Elders
The Glory of Primitive Methodism
The Great Deception
The Hidden Woman
sermons.description: Where can you find a virtuous woman? A call for wives to find their fulfillment in being a helpmeet to their husbands.

sermons.title: The Jewel Of Humility
The King's Daughters
The Marks of True Revival
sermons.description: When God answers sincere, desperate prayers for revival, He restores the life and reality that was once there. You will understand in a deeper way the depravity of man and the wages of sin. As you break your heart before Him, God will perform a sanctifying work in your life, you will find yourself overwhelmed with a true joy, and you will begin to be burdened for and to reach out to others.

sermons.title: The Ministry of Women in the Local Church
The Old-Fashioned Christian Home
sermons.description: Jer. 6:16 "Thus saith the Lord, Stand ye in the ways, and see, and ask for the old paths, where is the good way and ye shall find rest for your souls." Exhorts families to strive for the old paths in the midst of a fast-paced, trendy society.

sermons.title: The Path Into Bondage
sermons.description: Who are our enemies? The world, with its magnet-like force; the flesh, with its sinful desires; and the devil, with his evil suggestions. Brother Denny examines the techniques used by these enemies to lure us from God and capture us in sin.

sermons.title: The Pursuit of the Living God
The Radical Example of Moravian Missions
sermons.description: Brother Denny Kenaston shares on the radical history of the Moravian movement and the outpouring of the Holy Spirit in 1727. He recounts of how God worked in the past and exhorts believers in our day to believe God for great things and for Him to use us in our local areas in similar ways for the glory of God.

sermons.title: The Rise and Fall of God's House
The Shocking Reality of Spiritual War
sermons.description: We are engaged in a spiritual war between God and the devil. If we live in ignorance or casual indifference, the enemy will take us captive. We need to learn the rules, wake up, grow up, stand up and fight.

sermons.title: The Sin Of Gluttony
The Spirit And Practice Of Modest Apparel
sermons.description: Our clothes communicate a silent message. The message given by our clothes is both inward and outward. The burden of this sermon is that we will be right on the inside and right on the outside.

sermons.title: The Spirit Of Law And The Spirit Of Grace
sermons.description: There are those who live by the principle of law and there are those who live by the principle of grace. The one is ministry of condemnation; the other is a ministry of reconciliation.

sermons.title: The Spiritual Grace of Giving
The Travail of the Soul
The Unity of the Body of Christ
The Urgency and Supremacy of the Great Commission
Vital Signs in a New Church
Walking In The Overwhelming Presence Of God
What is Worship?
When God's Fire Falls
Where Were the Men?
Whispers of Victory
Whole Hearted Households by Denny Kenaston
sermons.description: Brother Denny shares the last of six sessions of the visionary aspect of childrearing of how whole-hearted households affect the next generation. He goes into detail of what an ordered Jewish home like one Jesus or John the Baptist was raised in to raise the bar of our own expectations. "A man's family," Kenaston says, "is the greatest revelation of who he is. Are we too busy to raise godly children that will "hit the mark" someday?

sermons.title: Worship, "As It Is In Heaven"
Youth: Anointed Disciples of Jesus Christ
